Body: I'm building a real time iot server using django and I'm fairly new to django. I have used django REST api so far to get data using HTTP requests, by using JSON. Now I want to further expand my project with the use of django websockets. How can I use websockets with REST api to capture real time data from iot? Or is it even possible to use websockets with REST api.

a REST API is by definition a synchronous, HTTP API. So it has little to do with websockets itself. But you can combine websockets with django using [django-channels](https://channels.readthedocs.io/en/latest/introduction.html). You can of course use serialisers and views from DRF to craft the content of your web socket streams, or include updating a channel when responding to a rest call. But they are more or less orthogonal, i.e. one doesn't preclude the other. They're different parts of your application.
Thank you for the insight. BTW https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HzC_pUhoW0I this video on youtube got me thinking of this notion, where connecting DRF and websockets.
nice video, interesting. Apparently my remark that rest and websockets are orthogonal is more accurate than the comment rest is synchronous. food for thought :-)
